image.altText: A police car behind police tape.

props.synopsis: Van Thanh Vu pleads guilty to murdering his partner in their family home in Canberra's north in 2023.

title.children: Man who stabbed partner to death in kitchen pleads guilty to murder

image.altText: a bearded man wearing a blue suit and sunglasses walks in front of the ACT Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A former sex worker stealthed by a customer tells the ACT Supreme Court despite the pain and suffering she hopes her attacker will find it "in his soul to become a better person".

title.children: Former Canberra sex worker tells of 'turmoil' after being stealthed

image.altText: 11 women standing behind a table with a cake on it with their hands up in celebration.

props.synopsis: What started out as three women called Shirley having a cuppa became an international club with thousands of members. But now the future of the club is bleak.

title.children: Shirley hated her name until she joined a same-name club

image.altText: Canberra Raiders NRL player Joe Tapine speaks to referee Adam Gee as rain falls during a game.

props.synopsis: Canberra coach Ricky Stuart warns against punishing aggression in rugby league as we head into the men's State of Origin series opener on Wednesday night.

title.children: Three Raiders charged as Ricky Stuart issues Origin warning

image.altText: A small tree with an orange banksia flower.

props.synopsis: Australian flora was once deemed too difficult to cultivate as bonsai but those misconceptions are fading with every native bud.

title.children: In recent years the banksia has become a surprise bonsai

image.altText: A teenage boy with short brown hair wearing glasses and headphones holding an iPad and a sensory soft toy stands smiling.

props.synopsis: For neurodivergent children, going to the emergency department can be overstimulating so the Canberra Hospital has introduced a sensory-friendly room in the children's emergency area to make the experience less overwhelming.

title.children: Max gets overwhelmed in hospital. A sensory-friendly room could help

image.altText: Police officers in high-viz clothing stand near ambulances in the street after an incident at a parade

props.synopsis: A man is arrested after a car hit pedestrians in the UK city of Liverpool during celebrations over the local football club's Premier League victory.

title.children: Dozens of Liverpool fans injured after car drives through victory parade

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson has pleaded not guilty to murdering her estranged husband's parents and his aunt by feeding them poisonous death cap mushrooms in July 2023. Follow the evidence live.

title.children: Erin Patterson's conversations with health official probed in court

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Court shown video taken during search
Images of Erin's plates shown to court

image.altText: Close up of a woman's hands typing at a computer keyboard with some jewellery on and a large fitness watch on her wrist

props.synopsis: Productivity is dominating headlines, but is it really possible to measure in Australia?

title.children: The great productivity debate is totally unproductive

image.altText: A corkboard filled with photos and documents connected by pinned thread. A photo of Margaret Thomas is in the middle.

props.synopsis: Retirees WA is suing the husband of its former chief executive in a bid to recoup millions of dollars loaned to companies linked to him.

title.children: Charity suing husband of former CEO in bid to claw back retirees' millions

image.altText: Data vis snap shot showing labels "Optus" and "Telstra"

props.synopsis: The communications regulator has not collected basic data on how telcos have implemented a new phone-blocking rule following the 3G network shutdown, despite flagging a potential "conflict of interest" inherent to it.

title.children: Telstra and Optus are inconsistently blocking phones. The regulator doesn't know how many

image.altText: An old man looks around his flood-affected living room as a middle-aged man in a firefighter's t-shirt carries a door past.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of homes are uninhabitable after record NSW floods. This is what it looks like returning to a street where most homes were under water.

title.children: At 89, Mick has seen many floods. This time, he lost everything

image.altText: Brothers Bobby and Tony Buttsworth are farmers standing outdoors next to a dog and in front their rain soaked paddock

props.synopsis: These third-generation dairy farmers have 500 mouths to feed and nothing but a paddock of mud after the floods devastated their NSW Mid North Coast property.

title.children: Last week these farmers were milking. Now their cows are set for the abattoir

image.altText: A woman looks over a charred and burnt out car in a residential car park.

props.synopsis: The Kremlin says people are beginning to experience "emotional overload" after the US president lashed out at continuing strikes on Ukraine.

title.children: Trump realising Putin 'lies', Macron says, as Kyiv hit by record drone strikes

image.altText: A woman sitting on a verandah and smiling.

props.synopsis: Sue Roman was one of hundreds of children taken from the notorious Darwin mission Retta Dixon and sent across the country to work as a servant.

title.children: Forced into slavery at 12, Sue Roman brought a royal commission to Darwin

image.altText: A man wearing a suit is shoved in the face by a woman wearing a red jacket who is blocked by a door

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron says he was "bickering, or rather joking" with his wife, Brigitte, when video captured her shoving him in the face while onboard the presidential jet that had touched down in Vietnam.

title.children: 'It's nothing': French president downplays face shove from wife

image.altText: Lando Norris leads Charles Leclerc at the Monaco hairpin

props.synopsis: At its core F1 is simple; build a fast car, employ a quick driver, and complete the race as soon as possible.

title.children: F1's dull and comical Monaco race proves you cannot manufacture fun

image.altText: Council crews in high vis clothing shovel fallen debris into the back of a truck

props.synopsis: Thousands of South Australian households and businesses are without power as the clean-up continues after the gusty winds, high rainfalls and high tides that lashed most of the state yesterday.

title.children: Thousands without power as SA cleans up after damaging storm

image.altText: A driveway and open wooden gate next to a single-storey house in a suburban area.

props.synopsis: Burnett MP Stephen Bennett says residents are struggling to process the death of the little girl. A woman has been charged with murder and is expected to face court today.

title.children: Small seaside town reeling after alleged murder of three-year-old girl

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: European markets have reacted to a sharp shift in US tariffs. Locally our market is awaiting new data on inflation that will inform when the next RBA interest rate cut is likely to occur. Follow live.

title.children: European tariff reaction, market awaits inflation read to inform next RBA rate cut

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 🎥 ATO warns millions of Aussies claiming work-related tax deductions
Four former VW managers convicted of fraud in emissions scandal

image.altText: A close-up photo of oranges growing on trees in the Moora Citrus orchard.

props.synopsis: Citrus growers are looking forward to a bountiful season in 2025, with hopes it could even become a record-breaking export year.

title.children: Citrus producers hopeful for bumper harvest after tough seasons

image.altText: A smiling man in police uniform leans against a police car outside a police station

props.synopsis: Police are spending an increasing amount of time responding to mental health crisis incidents. There's a push to have police removed from those responses altogether.

title.children: Push for police to be removed from mental health crisis responses

image.altText: A woman with long curly hair smiling resting on hand

props.synopsis: K A Ren Wyld's fellowship was rescinded last week after the state government complained about comments on the Gaza conflict posted by Ms Wyld on social media last year.

title.children: State library says it 'values' freedom of expression despite pulling fellowship

image.altText: Pets at Ovolo Hotels

props.synopsis: The cost of the accommodation for the chair, his wife and his "fur-baby Vito" at Brisbane's inner-city Ovolo hotel last year was queried by the company's CEO.

title.children: Government company chair stayed in five-star 'VIP' pet hotel room for meeting

image.altText: A boat washed on rocks with lots of debris in the water.

props.synopsis: Nestled on the Great Barrier Reef between two of Australia's most popular boating destinations is a radio blackspot zone leaving boaties with no phone or radio communication for days on end.

title.children: Dangerous blackspot on one of Australia's busiest sailing passages

image.altText: Ajla Tomljanovic clenches her fist

props.synopsis: Ajla Tomljanović has ended young comet Maya Joint's dream run as she reached the second round of the French Open along with Daria Kasatkina and Alexei Popyrin.

title.children: Tomljanović powers through, Kyrgios 'down' after another injury setback

image.altText: Terence Crawford poses

props.synopsis: Terence Crawford was once denied a visa to Australia due to outstanding parking tickets, but few will deny him entry to boxing's hall of fame no matter what happens against Saúl Canelo Álvarez.

title.children: Terence Crawford eyes boxing immortality against Saúl Canelo Álvarez

image.altText: A phone screen glows with a map of Launceston while mounted on a phone holder inside a car at dusk.

props.synopsis: A member of a prominent Melbourne family has been accused of being involved in unconscionable conduct in a bitter court battle involving a serial fraudster and a US lawsuit against Uber.

title.children: Melbourne businessman named in court battle involving rideshare giant Uber

image.altText: Two people kneel at the base of a tree.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs Town Council has apologised for removing a roadside memorial to a teenager without consulting his family or friends.

title.children: 'Beyond heartbreaking' removal of roadside memorial angers family

image.altText: nadine and her daughter smiling at a restaurant

props.synopsis: New research from Macquarie University finds 66 per cent of Australian parents who can choose when to send their child to school plan to start them later.

title.children: 'They are really little': Why parents delay sending children to school

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: The government is struggling to define and stick to its political narrative, while grappling with a law-and-order problem.

title.children: As shoppers ran in horror, Victoria's premier went into survival mode

image.altText: a wind turbine at sunset

props.synopsis: A co-op wind farm in Denmark, Western Australia is one of hundreds of "mid-level" energy projects being developed across Australia amid a growing trend of community-led investment.

title.children: WA's first community-owned wind farm set to double its output

image.altText: Sport underway inside proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: As draft legislation to get the proposed Macquarie Point stadium in Hobart built is released by the state government, it is revealed the estimated cost has risen again — to $945 million.

title.children: Hobart stadium cost up to $945m as enabling legislation released

image.altText: Young woman sits at the piano while a man leans on the piano.

props.synopsis: Clara Wieck Schumann was her father’s prodigy, a composer’s wife and a musician in her own right. Her story is still inspiring musicians today.

title.children: 'She was a pioneer': Clara Schumann still inspires musicians today
